column4: Anyone?  How do I do a network install from a standard install CD?
I don't believe you can. Is there any particular reason you're looking to?
Yes, I have a system with a failing cd-rom drive.  It will boot,but complete installation.  No floppy.
Is there a way to do a network install?  I may have asked the question wrong. :)
I don't think you can actually...
Just ot be sure: there is no network install for ubuntu?
I believe the answer is 'no' if you want support, and 'yes' if you like the possibility of pain and suffering :)
What i would like is the possibility of ubuntu on this box, but I'm quickly getting the imporession that today isn't the day to be asking. :)
The answer won't change another day. Its possible (and we've described how), but it isn't supported and you perform the task at your own risk
There is NOT an Ubuntu network installer at this moment in time
That is all you do... you install debian over the network, then you change the /etc/apt/sources.list to point to the hoary repositories rather than the deb ones... then you distupgrade
And if you're already doing that, then why are you being so dismissive of the channel's help?
What's the reponmse I should give so you and tritium no longer feel dismissed, so I can get on with my day?
Thank you for your help, I will try that now Then we'd say "No problem, come back if you have any other questions"
Thank you for your help, I will try that now.
No problem, please come back later and ask any questions you may have.
I plugged my printer in and it was detected and configured perfectly, automatically
I installed Ubuntu and my soundcard was configured perfectly and automatically :)

I was talking to you in private conversation because I was being polite. I felt you were being more hostile than was warranted but I didn't want my comments to reflect unnecessarily badly on you here.
I am neither
Terminal sudo esd -k && esd should do it
THanks, btw.
